title: How to Make a Lowfat Ice Cream Cake

steps.headline: Melt the "butter" for 20 seconds in the microwave.
Mix graham cracker crumbs with sugar substitute in a large bowl.
Add the melted butter and knead mix with your hands until fully combined.
Grease a glass pie pan with the cooking spray.
steps.description: Press the crust mixture into the bottom and sides of the pan.

steps.headline: Bake the crust for ten minutes or until lightly toasted.
steps.description: You will probably be able to smell that the crust is done, as well.

steps.headline: Let the crust cool for 30 minutes before adding the filling.
Mix Cool Whip with chocolate chips.
If you desire, add a few drops of food coloring to the original Cool Whip to create a fun colored filling.
steps.description: Fully combine for an even color throughout.

steps.headline: Pour the filling into the cooled crust.
steps.description: Smooth with the back of a spoon or a rubber bowl scraper.

steps.headline: Top with sprinkles and/or nuts, if you desire.
Freeze for about 3 hours.
steps.description: Let thaw for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

text: Making the Crust Preheat oven to 375 °F (191 °C).  Melt the "butter" for 20 seconds in the microwave.  Mix graham cracker crumbs with sugar substitute in a large bowl.  Add the melted butter and knead mix with your hands until fully combined.  Grease a glass pie pan with the cooking spray. Press the crust mixture into the bottom and sides of the pan. Bake the crust for ten minutes or until lightly toasted. You will probably be able to smell that the crust is done, as well. Let the crust cool for 30 minutes before adding the filling.  Making the Filling Mix Cool Whip with chocolate chips.  If you desire, add a few drops of food coloring to the original Cool Whip to create a fun colored filling. Fully combine for an even color throughout. Pour the filling into the cooled crust. Smooth with the back of a spoon or a rubber bowl scraper. Top with sprinkles and/or nuts, if you desire.  Freeze for about 3 hours. Let thaw for 10 minutes before slicing and serving. Finished.
